revised_title: Ion Diffusion in Gases at Low Pressure: Experiments with Radium and Ultra-Violet Light
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on the diffusion of ions in gases at low pressure using radium and ultra-violet light. They observed that the removal of water vapor from the gas produced a significant change in the motion of negative ions. The results showed a large increase in lateral diffusion as the pressure decreased and the electric force increased. This phenomenon is connected to the tendency of ions to assume the electronic state.
